items.text: got 'im! Stepped away and gave himself room to have an almighty flay at it. He intended to send it over cover, but only got an outside edge that went high in the air and settled safely into point's hands
items.shortText: Aftab Alam to Najmul Hossain Shanto, OUT

dismissal.text: Najmul Hossain Shanto c Rahmat Shah b Aftab Alam 6 (18b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

items.preText:
"Can anyone familiar with Nazmul Hossain Shanto tell us what he has done so great to warrant a place in this XI? I understood with Mehedi and Mossadek as they were known around BD at U19 level and early domestic level for being solid, talented cricketers but not sure what Shanto did?" - asks grayson.

Here's Mohammad Isam, our Bangladesh correspondent with the answer: "fter starting big in school cricket and finishing Youth ODIs (International U19 one-day matches) as its all-time highest run-getter, Nazmul Hossain Shanto has had a prolific time in domestic cricket. In the 2018 Dhaka Premier League List-A competition, he was the top run-getter playing for champion side Abahani. His 749 runs came at 57.61. He was also quite impressive in the 2017 BPL. He is regarded as one of the most talented top-order batsmen in Bangladesh today.

Having said that, his mindless slogging doesn't quite go with his upbringing as a batsman."
items.text: sharp turn starts off outside off and drifts in, pitches and comes back in further. pushed to square leg
items.shortText: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: overpitched and he comes forward to pat it to long-on
items.shortText: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: plumb It's that incoming delivery again. Mujeeb has Bangladesh in some bother now. Came back in and defeated his forward prod to strike him on the pad. Palpably in front, no need of a review
items.shortText: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Mohammad Mithun, OUT

dismissal.text: Mohammad Mithun lbw b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 1 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50.00

items.preText:
Bangladesh need Mushfiqur to go big

raghav: "Nazmul Hossain Shanto has done the exact same thing in 3 consecutive innings now. Play out 5 dot balls in a row, until he's on 5 off 15 or so, and then he goes for an ugly hoick only to get caught out 7 off 20. Is this really the best BD has to offer?"
items.text: again getting it to move into the batsman sharply. Mushfiqur defends it solidly

items.preText: "Good evening to all of you....I think captaincy and selection of playing 11 is main reason of failure of Bangladesh. When you have technical and pure batsman i.e Mominul Haque as a top order batsman in your squad then how can you pick Nazmul Husain Shanto over Mominul" - Moazzam Ahmad K isn't happy with team selection

items.text: gets hold of it better this time, comes on the front foot to an overpitched ball and clips it past the bowler to mid-on. Mujeeb could have fielded that perhaps, but he's been a half-step slower on his fielding today. No such problems with his bowling though
